alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued November 24 at 3:51AM HST until November 25 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .Surf along exposed north and west facing shores is peaking early this morning well above warning levels, which will continue through tonight as a significant northwest (320 degrees) swell moves through. A gradual downward trend is expected over the weekend, with heights dipping below advisory levels by the end of the day Sunday. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 7 to 10 feet. * WHERE...West facing shores of the Big Island exposed to large northwest swells. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
